title: Long before Jyoti, Pak had honey-trapped Madhuri: Held in 2010, found guilty in 2018
content: The arrest of YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra for allegedly sharing military secrets with Pakistan has echoes of the Madhuri Gupta case. Gupta, an Indian diplomat in Islamabad, was arrested in 2010 for espionage. She was honey-trapped by Pakistani intelligence, passing sensitive information after being manipulated by promises of love.

title: 'Army fully destroyed military infra in PoK's Leepa Valley during Op Sindoor'
content: The Indian Army's Chinar Corps executed Operation Sindoor, decimating military infrastructure in Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir's Leepa Valley, including posts, ammunition depots, and fuel storage. Officials estimate it will take Pakistan 8-12 months to rebuild, following retaliation for ceasefire violations. India also destroyed nine terror camps in Pakistan and PoK in response to the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: 'Spy ring': Kolkata influencer says Jyoti showed no interest in security sites
content: A Kolkata-based social media influencer, currently under scrutiny, has disclosed his interactions with YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, arrested for alleged espionage for Pakistan's ISI. He met Malhotra during her Kolkata visit in February, following an initial encounter at the Ram Temple inauguration in Ayodhya.

title: If Shubman Gill is India's next Test captain, who will be his deputy?
content: With Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli stepping away from Test cricket, the leadership mantle is up for grabs. Shubman Gill is poised to take over as Test captain, but it comes with a rider - who will be his deputy, a designated vice-captain, captain-in-waiting, or, in Indian cricketing history, a powerless foot-soldier.

title: Abhishek Banerjee to represent TMC in all-party delegation on Operation Sindoor
content: Following discussions between parliamentary affairs minister Kiren Rijiju and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee, the Trinamool Congress has nominated Abhishek Banerjee to represent the party in parliamentary delegations related to Operation Sindoor. This decision follows Banerjee's emphasis on the need for inclusive consultations in selecting delegation members. He also suggested including family members of martyrs and officers involved in Operation Sindoor.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of its Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: BJP takes 'nishan-e-Pakistan' jibe at Rahul Gandhi; Congress hits back
content: Bharatiya Janata Party criticized Congress leader Rahul Gandhi. The criticism is regarding Gandhi's remarks on Operation Sindoor. BJP accused Gandhi of echoing Pakistan's views. Amit Malviya shared an image linking Gandhi to Pakistan's military chief. Gandhi questioned the government about Indian aircraft losses. He alleged a forewarning to Pakistan. The Ministry of External Affairs rejected Gandhi's claims.

title: Punjab woman declares husband in US â€˜deadâ€™ for property
content: In Punjab's Jalandhar, a woman, along with the village sarpanch and a panchayat member, has been booked for allegedly attempting to obtain a false death certificate for her husband. Kuldeep Singh, who emigrated to the US via the 'dunki route' in 1998, never returned to India due to residency issues.

title: 3 dead, homes flooded, lakes overflow: Rainfall in 12 hrs brings Bengaluru to its knees
content: Bengaluru is reeling from torrential rainfall, resulting in three fatalities, widespread flooding affecting 500 homes, and significant infrastructure disruptions. The intense downpour, exceeding stormwater drain capacity, submerged streets, uprooted trees, and halted public transport. With more rain forecast, the city grapples with outdated drainage systems struggling to manage the impact of rapid urbanization and climate change.

title: Trump ally slams Jeff Bezos for 'ASSASSINATION GEAR on Amazon'; says: Wow ...
content: Laura Loomer, a Donald Trump ally, has accused Amazon of selling 'assassination gear' after James Comey's controversial Instagram post featuring seashells arranged as '8647'. Loomer shared screenshots of caps with '8647' on Amazon, tagging Jeff Bezos. Comey's post, interpreted by some as a threat to Trump, sparked outrage. Elon Musk also criticized Comey's post, calling it a serious crime.

title: 'Operated by foreign-based handlers': Pak-backed terror module busted in Punjab
content: Punjab Police busted a Babbar Khalsa International (BKI) terror module in Batala, arresting six members after a shootout. The module, backed by Pakistan's ISI, operated under foreign-based handlers Maninder Billa and Mannu Agwan, directed by Harwinder Singh Rinda. The arrested individuals were involved in grenade attacks, logistics, and financing.

title: Restrictions on Dubai gold: India tightens gold and silver imports from UAE
content: India has tightened import rules on gold and silver from the UAE, targeting unwrought, semi-manufactured, and powdered forms. The move, following the Budget 2025 announcement, aims to prevent misuse of the India-UAE CEPA by importers who mislabel gold as platinum alloy to exploit lower duties.

title: 'It's been challenging': Sanjiv Goenka on LSG's elimination
content: Abhishek Sharma's explosive half-century and Heinrich Klaasen's composed innings propelled Sunrisers Hyderabad to a six-wicket victory over Lucknow Super Giants, eliminating LSG from playoff contention. Despite Mitchell Marsh and Aiden Markram's fifties setting a strong foundation, Lucknow's late-over collapse proved costly. SRH successfully chased down the target, marking their first 200-plus chase at the Ekana Stadium.

title: Microsoft's fired AI director to 6,000 laid off employees: "These are people whoâ€¦"
content: Microsoft recently laid off approximately 6,000 employees, impacting various levels and teams. Gabriela de Queiroz, Director of AI for Startups, was among those affected, expressing sadness but maintaining a positive outlook. The layoffs coincide with Microsoft's aggressive push into AI, even as software engineers and AI leadership roles were impacted by the cuts.

title: Did US threaten to 'abandon' Israel if it continues war in Gaza?
content: Citing an unnamed source familiar with the talks, the Washington Post said that US officials have told Israel it could lose American backing if the conflict does not stop. "Trump's people are letting Israel know, 'We will abandon you if you do not end this war,'" the source was quoted as saying by the Washington Post.

title: 'Unseen, unstoppable': IAF showcases combat prowess, precision strikes in new video
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) released a video showcasing Operation Sindoor, its response to a Pakistan-backed terror attack in Pahalgam that killed 26. The IAF conducted precision strikes on terror-linked sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir, including Jaish-e-Mohammed and Lashkar-e-Taiba locations. Pakistan retaliated, leading to further IAF strikes on radar installations and airbases.

title: What is Stablecoin Regulation Bill? US Senate advances cryptocurrency legislation
content: The US Senate has moved forward with the Genius Act, a bill designed to regulate stablecoins. Despite Democratic concerns about President Trump's potential conflicts of interest due to his cryptocurrency ventures, the bill passed a key procedural vote. It introduces comprehensive regulations for stablecoins, including reserve requirements and consumer protections.

title: Akshay Kumar to sue Paresh Rawal for walking out of â€˜Hera Pheri 3â€™: Report
content: The comedy sequel 'Hera Pheri 3' faces a twist. Paresh Rawal, known as Baburao, left the film. Akshay Kumar's company, Cape of Good Films, sent Rawal a legal notice for Rs 25 crore. They claim Rawal quit unprofessionally after signing and starting the shoot. Rawal denies creative differences. Fans are upset about Rawal's exit. Filming began in April with Priyadarshan directing.

title: 300km viaduct completed: Sneak peek into Indiaâ€™s first bullet train project - Watch
content: India's first bullet train project, connecting Mumbai and Ahmedabad, has achieved a significant milestone with 300 km of viaduct work completed, announced Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw. The project, executed by NHSRCL, also includes the completion of a 350-meter mountain tunnel and the installation of India's first reinforced concrete track bed using Japanese Shinkansen technology.

title: 'It was a huge threat': Army destroys live Pakistani shell in J&K's Poonch
content: The Indian Army's bomb disposal squad safely detonated a live shell fired from Pakistan near a village in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district, averting a potential disaster. Residents expressed relief and gratitude, highlighting the army's crucial role in safeguarding the community.

title: IPL on-field spat: Before Rathi-Abhishek was Kieron Pollard-Mitchell Starc
content: An IPL 2025 match between Sunrisers Hyderabad and Lucknow Super Giants saw a fiery confrontation between Abhishek Sharma and Digvesh Rathi, sparked by Rathi's aggressive celebrations. Both players faced penalties, with Rathi receiving a heavier fine and suspension.

title: Why have H-1B visa applications plunged? Blame it on Trump!
content: H-1B visa applications for FY26 have significantly decreased, influenced by stricter regulations under Donald Trump's policies and increased application costs. Heightened scrutiny, including social media verification and rigorous documentation, contributes to the decline, alongside economic factors like tech industry layoffs.

title: UPSC Indian forest service exam 2024 result: Toppers and other details
content: The UPSC has declared the final results of the Indian Forest Service Examination 2024, recommending 143 candidates for appointment across various categories. The top rank was secured by Kanika Anabh. The result follows a rigorous selection process, including written exams and interviews. Two PwBD vacancies remain unfilled and will carry over to the next recruitment cycle.

title: Ashoka University professor in lockup, colleagues keep vigil at police station in shifts
content: Ali Khan Mahmudabad, a professor at Ashoka University, was arrested following a complaint. The complaint was filed by Haryana State Women's Commission chairperson Renu Bhatia. It alleges his comments on Operation Sindoor endangered India's sovereignty. Colleagues are providing support to Mahmudabad. They are ensuring his well-being while he is in custody. The faculty association has condemned the arrest.

title: Gold rates plunged over Rs 6,500 from all time high; where is it headed?
content: Gold rate today: Gold futures on MCX opened lower, while silver also saw a decline. Prices have fluctuated, influenced by Moody's US credit rating downgrade and Russia-Ukraine peace talk hopes.

title: Who is Ali Khan Mahmudabad? Ashoka Univ prof arrested over 'Op Sindoor' remark
content: Ali Khan Mahmudabad, an Ashoka University professor, was arrested by Haryana Police following a social media post about Operation Sindoor, which was perceived as critical of the military. The arrest, based on a complaint from a BJP Yuva Morcha leader, has ignited controversy and sparked widespread support for Mahmudabad from students and colleagues.

title: STEMming the Tide: Why women are still missing from labs and leadership
content: Despite progress in university enrollment, a UNESCO report highlights a persistent gender gap in STEM fields globally. Women are underrepresented in engineering, technical training, and digital skills, particularly in low-income countries. Even with STEM education, they face barriers to leadership roles. Systemic changes, including mentorship and flexible policies, are crucial to ensure women can fully contribute to innovation and progress.

title: Jofra Archer mimics Ravindra Jadeja's bowling and nails it perfectly
content: Rajasthan Royals' Jofra Archer delighted fans by mimicking Ravindra Jadeja's bowling action during a practice session, showcasing his playful side. The amusing video, shared by Rajasthan Royals, quickly went viral. In IPL 2025, Chennai Super Kings and Rajasthan Royals are set to clash at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. For CSK, the 2025 season has been largely disappointing, with all departments faltering.

title: Digvesh Rathi suspended for one match after spat with Abhishek Sharma
content: Lucknow Super Giants bowler Digvesh Rathi has been penalised for violating the IPL Code of Conduct during a match against Sunrisers Hyderabad. He was fined 50% of his match fees and suspended for one game due to accumulating five demerit points this season.

title: Wooden blocks on tracks: Plot to derail 2 trains foiled in UP
content: Averted disaster struck in Uttar Pradesh's Hardoi district as vigilant loco pilots foiled attempts to derail two passenger trains, including the Rajdhani Express. Wooden blocks tied to the tracks with earthing wires were spotted by the Rajdhani Express pilot, who applied emergency brakes. A similar attempt targeting the Kathgodam Express was also thwarted.

title: 'War 2â€™ Teaser: Hrithik, Jr NTR & Kiara's power-packed first glimpse is out
content: 'War 2â€™ Teaser:  Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR are set to ignite screens in 'War 2', the sixth installment of the YRF Spy Universe, directed by Ayan Mukerji. Jr NTR's Bollywood debut as the antagonist promises a clash of titans. The film boasts globe-trotting espionage, high-octane action sequences, and a musical face-off composed by Pritam.

title: Protean eGov shares plummet 30% after not being selected for PAN 2.0 project
content: Protean eGov Technologies' shares have plummeted over 30% in two days after the Income Tax Department rejected their bid for the PAN 2.0 systems upgrade project. This decline erases the stock's gains from the past year.

title: Married 25 men in 7 months: 'Loot and scoot' bride arrested from Bhopal
content: Rajasthan Police have arrested a 23-year-old woman, Anuradha Paswan, in Bhopal for allegedly defrauding 25 men across multiple states within seven months. Dubbed the "loot-and-scoot bride," she targeted desperate grooms, marrying them and fleeing with valuables shortly after the wedding.

title: Noted astrophysicist Jayant Narlikar passes away at 87 in Pune
content: Jayant Narlikar, the esteemed astrophysicist and founder of IUCAA, died in Pune on Tuesday. Born in 1938, he studied at Cambridge and later contributed significantly to cosmology, advocating alternative models to the Big Bang theory. Narlikar was also a celebrated science communicator and author, survived by his three daughters, all scientists, following the passing of his wife in 2023.

title: Ceasefire! BCCI VP steps in to end Abhishekâ€“Digvesh Rathi fight
content: In an IPL 2025 match where SRH defeated LSG, eliminating them from playoff contention, a heated moment occurred. Young cricketers Abhishek Sharma and Digvesh Rathi engaged in a confrontation after Rathi dismissed Sharma. BCCI Vice-President Rajeev Shukla intervened, mediating a reconciliation between the two players. Abhishek, despite not reaching his peak performance in IPL 2025, has maintained better batting statistics compared to his SRH teammates. He aims to finish strong in the team's final two matches of the season.

title: India eyes three-phase trade deal with US as Trumpâ€™s reciprocal tariffs loom
content: India and the US are engaged in trade deal negotiations, aiming to finalize an initial agreement before July, when US tariffs take effect. The proposed deal is structured in three phases, addressing industrial goods, agricultural products, and non-tariff barriers. Discussions are ongoing, with hopes for a broader agreement by autumn, potentially coinciding with a Quad summit visit.

title: Sunil Gavaskar fires shots at KKR over Shreyas Iyer snub
content: Shreyas Iyer has achieved a unique milestone by leading Punjab Kings to the IPL 2025 playoffs, marking his third franchise to reach this stage. Sunil Gavaskar highlighted Iyer's underappreciated role in KKR's previous title win, emphasizing his on-field leadership. Iyer praised his team's unity and support after their victory over Rajasthan Royals, urging them to maintain momentum.

title: 'From Rawalpindi to Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, India can strike anywhere in Pak'
content: Lt Gen Sumer Ivan D'Cunha asserted India's capability to strike any target within Pakistan, emphasizing the nation's preparedness to respond across the entire depth of Pakistani territory if needed. Operation Sindoor showcased India's use of locally developed technology, including long-range drones and guided munitions, to strike key Pakistani airbases.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in green; BSE Sensex above 82,000
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday but quickly moved to the red territory. While Nifty50 went below 24,800, BSE Sensex was below 81,500.

title: '1-year jail not a prerequisite for bail to accused in laundering case': SC to ED
content: The Supreme Court clarified on Monday that there's no mandatory one-year jail term before bail in money laundering cases, granting relief to an accused in the Chhattisgarh liquor scam. Justices Oka and Bhuyan emphasized that a year-long custody isn't a prerequisite for bail.

title: Abhishek Sharma's fiery reply to Digvesh Rathi's send-off - Watch
content: During the IPL 2025 match between LSG and SRH, a heated exchange erupted between Digvesh Rathi and Abhishek Sharma after Rathi dismissed Sharma. Sharma, visibly upset by Rathi's celebration, was caught on camera uttering threats. This incident overshadowed impressive performances from Mitchell Marsh, Aiden Markram, and Nicholas Pooran for LSG, as well as Sharma's explosive innings for SRH.

title: Indian envoy demands Hafiz Saeed's extradition, asks if US did it, why can't Pakistan?
content: India's ambassador to Israel, JP Singh, asserted that Operation Sindoor, initiated in response to Pakistan's cross-border terrorism, remains paused, not concluded. He urged a global coalition against terrorism, demanding Pakistan hand over key figures like Hafiz Saeed. Singh highlighted India's firm stance against terrorism, emphasizing that treaties require an end to Pakistan's support for terrorist activities.

title: Rishabh Pant's worst IPL season: How much is he costing per run scored?
content: Rishabh Pant's struggles continued as Lucknow Super Giants were eliminated from IPL 2025 playoff contention after a loss to Sunrisers Hyderabad. Pant's poor form with the bat added to LSG's woes, with his low score contributing to his disappointing season. Injuries to key bowlers further hampered LSG's chances, impacting their overall performance despite a strong batting lineup.

title: Divya Gopikumar aka Abhirami: Actress making waves after bold scene with Kamal Haasan
content: Abhirami, also known as Divya Gopikumar, is experiencing a resurgence in popularity following the release of the 'Thug Life' trailer. A scene featuring her and Kamal Haasan has sparked considerable discussion online, overshadowing her previous roles in films like 'Virumaandi'. The film 'Thug Life' is scheduled for release on June 5, 2025.

title: Breathe, walk, heal: Forest bathing, Japanâ€™s lush prescription for modern-day burnout
content: In today's fast-paced world, forest bathing, or Shinrin-yoku, offers a powerful antidote to urban pollution and sedentary lifestyles. This Japanese practice involves mindful immersion in nature, promoting physical and psychological well-being. Scientific studies reveal that forest environments enhance immune function and improve respiratory health, making it a valuable preventive medicine.

title: Buy or sell: Stock market recommendations for today
content: Stock market recommendations: Mirae Asset Sharekhan suggests buying Dabur and Gail. Dabur, trading between Rs 480-488, is expected to resume its uptrend after breaking a downward trendline, targeting Rs 519. Similarly, Gail, recommended in the Rs 188-191 range, anticipates an upward movement to Rs 213 following a bullish flag pattern breakout, supported by positive momentum indicators.

title: Nehru gave Pak not only water but also money: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: Days after calling the 1960 treaty a "historic mistake", Union agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Monday met farmers organisations and explained to them how the then PM Jawaharlal Nehru signed the treaty despite opposition from experts. He said that Nehru not only agreed to give water to Pakistan at the cost of India but also gave Rs 83 crore to the neighbouring country, whose value now amounts to Rs 5,500 crore.

title: NBA playoff MVPs: Herring's new top 8 after the conference semis
content: Our playoff MVP update features a Game 7 savior, two Wolves and a superstar who hasn't played in three weeks.

title: Clark, Fever back investigation: No place for hate
content: Fever players on Monday supported the WNBA's investigation into allegations of "hateful fan comments" toward the Sky's Angel Reese.

title: Mets to talk to Soto about hustling out of box
content: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said he'll talk to Juan Soto about hustling out of the batter's box, while Soto claimed it hasn't been an issue.

title: Sources: 49ers make Warner NFL's top-paid LB
content: Linebacker Fred Warner and the 49ers reached agreement on a three-year, $63 million contract extension that includes over $56 million in guaranteed money, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Packers submit revision for tush push proposal
content: With the NFL's league meetings set to open up in Minneapolis on Tuesday, the Packers submitted a revision of their rule proposal that would more broadly ban pushing or pulling the ball carrier anywhere on the field, a strategy popularized by the Eagles.

title: NHL referee Rooney OK, hopes for playoff return
content: NHL referee Chris Rooney is hoping to resume duties during the Stanley Cup playoffs after taking a high stick to the eye in Game 7 of the second-round Eastern Conference playoff series between the Toronto Maple Leafs and Florida Panthers on Sunday night.

title: W. Clark sorry for flinging driver after errant shot
content: Wyndham Clark apologized for letting his frustrations get the best of him and flinging his driver after a poor shot during the final round of the PGA Championship.

title: Haliburton invites man trashed by N.Y. fans to G4
content: A Pacers fan pelted by garbage and heckled for wearing a Tyrese Haliburton jersey on the streets of New York City has been invited to Game 4 vs. the Knicks.

title: GM: Cavs must meet newly raised expectations
content: Cavaliers GM Koby Altman realizes expectations for the Cavaliers going into next season will be much different following a season that saw Cleveland win 64 games and earn the East's top seed.

title: ðŸ“š NFL rookie's taste of being a pro
content: Rookies including Tyler Warren, Josh Conerly Jr. and Nick Martin share insight on their first days as an NFL player.

title: Eight things we learned from the WNBA's opening weekend
content: The Mystics might be better than projected. The Fever defense is better, period. Here's what we learned as the WNBA season opened.

title: How proposed CEO could dole out punishments in college sports
content: A decision on the House case is expected as soon as this week and could come with enforcement changes.

title: Who wins the Eastern Conference finals? Early look at keys to Hurricanes-Panthers
content: It's a rematch of the 2023 edition. Can Carolina win this time, or will Florida head back to the Cup Final?

title: Predicting Rounds 1 and 2 of the NBA draft after the combine
content: The draft could get interesting at No. 3. Here's how ESPN's Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo see it playing out.

title: J.K. Dobbins to the Commanders? Jalen Ramsey to the Rams? Best fits for free agents, trade candidates
content: Some unsigned free agents are still looking for new teams, while there are often trades before training camps start in July. Given that, let's find fits for 14 available players.

title: Where things stand for each Ryder Cup team after two majors
content: Which players are locks to make each team? What tough decisions will captains Keegan Bradley and Luke Donald have to make? We break down how each team is shaping up.

title: 'Ueck was always first': How Christian Yelich is carrying on Bob Uecker's legacy with Brewers
content: Whether he's starring or slumping, Christian Yelich has taken the torch as the face of the franchise in Milwaukee.

title: How Amorim, Man United made Europa League final in spite of themselves
content: Man United are on the precipice heading into Wednesday's Europa League final vs. Tottenham, with more drama swirling around the club. And yet, a major trophy could represent a turning point.

title: Palace FA Cup joy, two-team Serie A title race goes to wire, more
content: Crystal Palace shocked Man City, Barcelona celebrated LaLiga success and Italy's title race had more drama.

title: Liverpool ratings: Salah gets 5/10 as champs fall to Brighton
content: Despite getting a guard of honor, Brighton & Hove Albion spoiled Liverpool's party where Mohamed Salah was unable to make an impact.

title: KakÃ¡ on links with Ancelotti, Brazil: 'I'm ready'
content: Former Brazil icon KakÃ¡ addressed reports that he is in talks to join Carlo Ancelotti's backroom staff, saying he is "ready" to help his country at the 2026 World Cup should he get the opportunity.

title: Source: Man City back out of race for Wirtz
content: After meeting with Bayer Leverkusen and Florian Wirtz's representatives, Manchester City are turning their attention to other targets, a source told ESPN.

title: Brighton beat Liverpool to maintain European bid
content: Substitute Jack Hinshelwood struck a late winner as Brighton & Hove Albion came from behind to grab a 3-2 victory over visiting champions Liverpool that keeps their slim hopes of playing in Europe next season alive after twice coming from behind.

title: Conte, Inzaghi banned for Serie A deciders Friday
content: A quarter of Serie A coaches will be missing from the dugout for their teams' final matches of the season, including title hopefuls Antonio Conte and Simone Inzaghi.

title: Canada's Marsch 'sad' about Gold Cup travel fears
content: Canada coach Jesse Marsch understands some of his team's supporters might not want to travel to the CONCACAF Gold Cup for fear of difficulty at the U.S. border.

title: Pep on UCL quali: City will get what we deserve
content: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola said on Monday that he was "absolutely" confident his side can seal one of the top five spots in the Premier League.

title: Valencia threaten to sue over Netflix Vini doc
content: Valencia have asked for an "immediate rectification" from the producers of VinÃ­cius JÃºnior's Netflix documentary.

title: Lineker leaves BBC after controversial IG post
content: The BBC has announced that Gary Lineker will step down from his presenting role following the final episode of this season's Match of the Day.

title: MLS: Miami sliding as Philly reeling in Caps
content: Inter Miami have lost five of its past seven, losing touch with the leaders of ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers slight East favorites
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Hamilton is optimistic after Imola, but Leclerc showcases Ferrari's ills
content: Lewis Hamilton was giddy after Imola, but that shouldn't overshadow Charles Leclerc's frustrations at Ferrari.

title: Waiver wire: NL Central southpaws lead top picks
content: Eric Karabell outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United holding talks for Delap
content: Arsenal and Chelsea remain interested in signing Newcastle United winger Anthony Gordon. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Judges also human': Justice Abhay S Oka admits error in judgment

title: 40-Year-Old ASHA Worker's Body Found In UP, Rape Suspected: Cops
content: A 40-year-old ASHA worker was found dead in a maize field in Alapur area here, with police suspecting sexual assault.

title: "Courts Cannot Intervene Unless...": Chief Justice's Big Remark On Waqf Law
content: There is a presumption of constitutionality in legislation that clears Parliament and courts cannot interfere unless a glaring case is made out, Chief Justice of India BR Gavai told the petitioners challenging the Waqf Amendment Act today.

title: Yusuf Pathan Out, Abhishek Banerjee In: Trinamool Switch In India Outreach
content: Trinamool MP Abhishek Banerjee will be part of the parliamentary delegation that will carry India's anti-terror message to the world, the party said.

title: 'Diddy' Threatened To Kill After I Saw Him Beat Cassie: Pop Singer Testifies
content: Singer Dawn Richard told jurors at Sean "Diddy" Combs' sex trafficking trial on Monday that the hip-hop mogul threatened to kill her if she told anyone she saw him physically abusing his longtime girlfriend.

title: YouTube Star Educator Ms Rachel Accurso Draws Outrage Over Gaza Appeals
content: Last year, Ms Rachel began speaking out about the plight of children in Gaza, peppering her account with appeals for aid that sowed discord among followers and spurred calls for a federal investigation. A shift from sing-songy educational content.

title: US Woman Charged After She Accidentally Crushed Her Infant While Moving Car
content: A New Jersey mother has been charged with causing the death of her infant child while driving without a valid license, the Ocean County Prosecutor's Office said.

title: CBS News CEO Wendy McMahon Resigns Amid Trump Lawsuit
content: US President Donald Trump is suing CBS owner and media giant, Paramount for $20 billion in damages over the contents of a pre-election interview last year with his Democratic rival, Kamala Harris.

title: Trump's Massive Tariffs Haven't Done Much Economic Damage Yet
content: Trump has plastered 10% taxes on imports from almost every country on earth. He's also imposed 25% duties on cars, aluminum, steel, and many imports from Canada and Mexico.

title: Covid-19 Cases Spike In Asia: About JN.1 Variant And Affected Countries
content: A resurgent wave of Covid-19 is spreading through Southeast Asia, with densely populated regions in Hong Kong, Singapore, China and Thailand witnessing a spike in cases.

title: Number Of Deaths Due To Rain In Bengaluru Rises To 5
content: The IMD has issued an orange alert for Bengaluru and a yellow alert at various places across Karnataka on Tuesday.

title: After 3 Years Of Negotiations, WHO Pandemic Agreement Gets Adopted
content: Members of the World Health Organization adopted a landmark agreement on Tuesday on how to prepare for future pandemics following the COVID-19 outbreak, which killed millions of people between the years of 2020 and 2022.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Foreign Policy Is Not Just High-Table Talk. It Matters
content: Foreign policy involves much more than just eloquent speeches; it means working strategically for an authoritative, or at least more representative, seat at the high tables of global governance.

title: She Married 25 Men To Rob Them. Then Cops Came Up With A Decoy Groom
content: Anuradha Paswan has been arrested for cheating 25 grooms and fleeing with jewellery and cash worth lakhs.

title: Southwest Monsoon Likely To Reach Kerela in 4-5 Days: Weather Office
content: The southwest monsoon is likely to reach Kerala in the next four-five days, much earlier than the usual date of June 1, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Tuesday.

title: Apple Supplier Foxconn To Invest $1.5 Billion In India
content: Apple supplier Foxconn will invest 1.5 billion rupees in India, the company said in a filing, as the iPhone maker shifts more manufacturing out of tariff-hit China.

title: In Kanpur Murder, A Meerut Reminder: Conspiracies And Extra-Marital Affair
content: The gruesome murder of a man in Kanpur has revealed multiple layers of conspiracy, an extramarital affair, and a modus operandi that matches partly with the Meerut killing that had sent shockwaves through the country two months ago.

title: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw Shares An Update On Bullet Train Project
content: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw shared an update on the country's ambitious Bullet Train Project on Tuesday, announcing the completion of 300 kilometres of viaduct.

title: Trump Criticises Kennedy Center's Management For Building's "Dire Shape"
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday lambasted the former leadership of the Kennedy Center, saying the renowned Washington cultural institution's days of "rampant political propaganda" were over since he took the reins.

title: "Bilawal Bhutto Better At Dancing, Should Focus On That": BJP's Jay Panda
content: The Centre's decision to send delegations abroad to brief world powers on Operation Sindoor and expose Pakistan is part of an ongoing reset in India's response to terrorism, senior BJP leader Baijayant 'Jay' Panda has said.

title: Scottie Scheffler is still on top of the golf world
content: charLOTTE, n.c., wins his third career major title . scottie Scheffler finishes 12 under par to secure his third major championship . sergio aguero finishes 12th under par after a stern facial expression .

title: Week 14: Top 25 rankings and what to watch
content: the LSU Tigers remain no. 1 but there was plenty of shakeup in the rest of the rankings . this week's biggest risers were Southern Miss, who jumped up nine spots, and the surging Florida Gators, who are now at no. 15 .

title: QB tiers for every FBS program: Returning stars, blue-chip freshmen, transfers and, of course, Arch Manning
content: 2025 is the unofficial end point of the bonus year . if you're Diego Pavia, who might play until he's eligible to collect social security . some of last season's rules allowed players to stick around for five, six or even seven years .

title: NBA playoffs betting: How to bet the conference finals
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder take on the Minnesota Timberwolves in the Western Conference . the new york Knicks face the Indiana Pacers in the eastern conference . for latest odds go to ESPN BET Timberwolves +1.5 games (+140)

title: Early look at the Stars-Oilers matchup in the Western Conference finals
content: the Western Conference finals matchup is set for 2025 . the Dallas Stars and Edmonton Oilers are poised to square off to determine which club will represent the West in the Stanley Cup Final . we're here with key intel from ESPN Research, wagering info from ESPN BET .

title: Was Imola a one-off or is Verstappen now a title contender?
content: Max Verstappen finishes ahead of Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri to win the Emilia-Romagna Grand Prix . the four-time world champion returns to his happy place for 63 laps . he was beaten by a 22-point deficit in the championship at the japanese grand prix .

title: NWSL: Chawinga's brilliance keeps Current No. 1
content: Temwa Chawinga scored a goal to put the Kansas City Current ahead . the current beat the Pride 1-0 on friday . it's a week of NWSL action in the books . if you make a single mistake, you're likely to get punished .

title: Ola Krutrim says it is extending full support to family of employee who died
content: Ola's AI arm Krutrim on Sunday said it is extending full support to the family of an employee whose body was retrieved from a lake

title: Monsoon likely to reach Kerala in 4-5 days: India Meteorological Department
content: India Meteorological Department predicts early arrival of southwest monsoon in Kerala, crucial for agriculture and water resources in India

title: Kerala womenâ€™s team wins Spirit Championship at national-level Ultimate Frisbee tournament on debut
content: The 19-member team won the title for the upholding the spirit of the game, despite a group-stage exit at the fourth edition of the Bharat Trophy

title: India, United States discuss expediting conclusion of first phase of trade pact
content: Piyush Goyal met U.S. Secretary Howard Lutnick in Washington to speed up talks on the first phase of the India-U.S. trade deal

title: In Pictures | Rain fury in Udupi, Manipal
content: The IMD had issued a red alert (extremely heavy rainfall above 204.5 mm) for coastal Karnataka on May 20 and May 21

title: Public gathering to mark two years of Congress government in Karnataka begins amid torrential rains in Hosapete
content: Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda, who welcomed the dignitaries and the public, described the rain as a divine blessing for a government that, in his view, has fulfilled its promises

title: Krishnagiriâ€™s KRP, Kelavarapalli dams opened; flood alert issued for three districts
content: Krishnagiri received an average rainfall of 24.31 mm with Hosur recording the maximum rainfall of 74.4mm, followed by Denkanikottai receiving 57 mm.

title: Trinamool Congress nominates Abhishek Banerjee to be part of all-party delegation on Operation Sindoor
content: Trinamool Congress had opted out from the all-party panel when the Centre nominated MP Yusuf Pathan to be part of one such delegation

title: Heavy rain inundates Guwahati, normal life affected
content: Rainwater accumulated in hundreds of houses in the â€˜smartâ€™ city, and there were reports of power cuts in many areas

title: Brajesh Pathak renews attack on Akhilesh Yadav, says he is willing to have thesis written on Samajwadi Party's DNA
content: U.P. Deputy CM criticised Akhilesh Yadav for evading the core issue of appeasement, remarking that he responded to a political question with a home science guide

title: Chhagan Bhujbal, OBC stalwart who kept himself relevant amid changes in Maharashtra politics
content: Chhagan Bhujbal's political career began with the Shiv Sena in the 1980s, winning the Mazgaon assembly seat (Mumbai) in 1986 and 1990.

title: Government may try as much to cover up 'India's biggest scam', the truth is coming out: Congress on Adani issue
content: Congress flags SEBI warning to offshore funds holding Adani shares, alleges delay benefits Adani and calls for transparency

title: Suspended Raj Bhavan employee arrested again for theft of hard disk
content: Police emphasised that it was an internal incident involving a suspended employee, and no documents of official importance were lost or compromised

title: HC issues notice to Shashi Tharoor on Rajeev Chandrasekhar's defamation plea
content: Mr. Chandrasekhar alleged that Mr. Tharoor defamed him by making "false" and "derogatory" statements on national television, claiming the BJP leader "bribed" voters in the Thiruvananthapuram constituency during the 2024 Lok Sabha elections

title: Delays and opacity in regulatory clearance can impact timely conclusion of FTAs: Nirmala Sitharaman
content: â€œIn todayâ€™s interconnected and fast-paced economy, delays in regulatory clearance can lead to uncertainty, disrupt commercial timelines and potentially erode the intended value of transactions and globally it has an impact, even as we negotiate free trade agreements with different countries,â€ Ms. Sitharaman said

title: Battle on for LDF govtâ€™s third term in power in Kerala, says CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan
content: CPI(M) leader claims Opposition UDF has not been able to launch any effective agitation against Left government in Kerala in past four years

title: Six-member committee formed for comprehensive investigation of  Gulzar Houz fire accident
content: A report, including suggestions to people to avoid such fire accidents, would be submitted to Chief Minister

title: Supreme Court makes three yearsâ€™ legal practice mandatory to apply for judicial service
content: A Bench headed by Chief Justice of India BR Gavai, in a judgment, concluded that infusion of fresh law graduates with zero experience in litigation was found to be detrimental.

title: Madhya Pradesh Police sets up SIT to probe Vijay Shahâ€™s remarks against Colonel Qureshi
content: Supreme Court had directedÂ the constitution of a three-member Special Investigation Team toÂ probe the FIRÂ against Madhya Pradesh Minister Vijay Shah

title: Bid to derail two trains, including Rajdhani, foiled in Uttar Pradeshâ€™s Hardoi: police
content: Alert loco pilots thwart attempt by unidentified miscreants to derail trains in Uttar Pradesh; police probing the incidents

title: Kerala moves SC to protect its â€˜large percentage of Muslimsâ€™ from 2025 Waqf amendments
content: The State said it found many of the provisions of the amendment Act â€œhighly unjust and their constitutional validity doubtfulâ€.

title: Noted astrophysicist Jayant Narlikar passes away at 87
content: A towering figure in Indian science, Dr Narlikar was widely known for his pioneering contributions to cosmology, his efforts to popularise science, and for setting up premier research institutions in the country

title: Ankita murder case: Uttarakhand court completes hearing, to announce verdict on May 30
content: Ankita Bhandari (19), who worked as a receptionist at Vanantra Resort located in Yamkeshwar of Pauri district, was murdered allegedly by the resort operator, along with his two employees

title: Uttarakhand High Court refuses to intervene in demolition of rape accused's house
content: Uttarakhand High Court refuses to intervene in demolition of rape accusedâ€™s house; wife unable to respond due to husbandâ€™s imprisonment

title: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis expands cabinet; NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal inducted
content: Senior NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal on May 20 took oath as a Minister in the Maharashtra government at the Raj Bhavan.

title: Impossible to compare fingerprints of the dead with Aadhaar database, UIDAI tells Madras High CourtÂ
content: Makes the submission in response to a case filed by Tamil Nadu police seeking Aadhaar data to ascertain identity an unknown body

title: Kerala braces for more rains as four districts put on orange alert
content: IMD issues yellow alert for Pathanamthitta, Alappuzha, Kottayam, Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, Palakkad and Malappuram districts on Tuesday

title: Free agency and draft plans for Maple Leafs, Capitals, every other eliminated team
content: the 2024-25 NHL regular season is over and the playoffs are underway . this is the place where we look ahead to the offseason for all the eliminated teams . read on for a look at what went wrong for each eliminated team .

title: Bengaluru rain LIVE: IMD issues orange alert for Bengaluru, red alert in Karnataka coastal districts
content: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said remodelling and removing silt from clogged storm-water drains (SWDs) are being taken up on a war footing.

title: Waqf (Amendment) Act hearing LIVE: Amendments pave way for waqfs to lose their status retrospectively, petitioners tell SC
content: Over 100 petitioners have moved the top court against the amendments, contending that they infringed upon the rights of Muslims. The court is expected to consider granting an interim stay on the provisions

title: No caste issue, MCOCA implementation has begun: Ajit Pawar in Beed assault caseÂ
content: A man was abducted and then attacked by a mob with iron rods, belt, glass bottles and wooden stick recently in Maharashtra

title: How high-yielding seeds became symbols of modernity during Green Revolution
content: During the green revolution, the State positioned itself as the custodian and distributor of scientific progress, says Abhinav Tyagi, science historian and former research fellow at NCBS Archives. He presented a talk on â€˜Revisiting the Green Revolution: Statecraft of cultivating modernityâ€™ in Bengaluru

title: Monkey scare leads to unexpected diagnosis, facilitating treatment of a 32-year-old woman
content: The patient was diagnosed with brain aneurysm and subarachnoid haemorrhage, a serious neurological emergency

title: M.R. Srinivasan, former Atomic Energy Commission Chairman, passes awayÂ
content: Srinivasan worked alongside Homi Bhabha on the construction of Indiaâ€™s first nuclear research reactor, Apsara, which achieved criticality in August 1956

title: Tamil Nadu government doctors seek WHO intervention on staffing and pay disparities
content: The committee has requested the WHO to urge the Tamil Nadu government to ensure appropriate staffing in hospitals and implement salary parity in accordance with the relevant government orders and national recommendations

title: Calcutta High Court issues contempt rule against Trinamool Congress leader Kunal Ghosh, seven others
content: Chief Justice of the Calcutta High Court, T.S. Sivagnanam has taken suo motu cognisance of the matter involving the heckling of lawyers, including senior advocate Bikash Ranjan Bhattacharya and has constituted a special three-judge Bench for the hearing.

title: Elephants kill three villagers in M.P.â€™s Shahdol; CM orders probe, announces aid
content: A forest officer said that two wild elephants from the neighbouring Bandhavgarh Tiger Reserve are believed to have killed the locals

title: Congress government in Karnataka completes two years with bouquets and brickbats
content: Siddaramaiah hopes to break the record of being the longest-serving Chief Minister of Karnataka, held by D. Devaraj Urs

title: Fadnavis slams SLBC for not taking action against those seeking CIBIL score from farmers
content: Urging the SLBC to take action against all those bank branches that continue to seek CIBIL scores from the farmers, the Chief Minister said that the practice continues in the State despite previous FIRs in the matter

title: No maintenance if divorce granted on the ground of adultery, says Chhattisgarh HC
content: Both applicants had solemnised their marriage in July 2019 and the woman alleged that after a few days of marriage, she was subjected to mental torture and her character questioned by the husband

title: Panel discussion held to seek justice for Rohingya refugees
content: Human rights lawyers Prashant Bhushan, Colin Gonsalves, and social activist Harsh Mander were present at the panel discussion in the national capital along with journalist Pamela Philipose, human rights activist Rita Manchanda and social worker Priyali Sur

title: Odisha to identify Bangladeshis, disengage them from jobs in State
content: Government to initially focus on six coastal districts and later expand the exercise to the entire State

title: SC sets timelines to facilitate repair of Mullaperiyar dam, tree-felling near site
content: On noting that Kerala had consented to the transportation of materials required for six of the nine repair works pointed out by Tamil Nadu, the apex court said there was hardly any â€œjustificationâ€ to not allow the transportation of material required for the remaining three works.

title: Jaishankar holds wide-ranging discussions with Dutch counterpart on deepening bilateral partnership
content: The External Affairs Minister appreciated the Netherlandsâ€™ strong condemnation of the Pahalgam attack and support for zero tolerance against terrorism.

title: Cyber fraud complaints of over â‚¹10 lakh, lodged via helpline or portal, to automatically convert into FIRs
content: The e-Zero FIR initiative has been launched on a pilot basis first in Delhi; complaints have to be registered on the 1930 helpline or cybercrime.gov.in portal

title: Supreme Court grants interim relief to DICCI in sanitation scheme case
content: Bench led by CJI Gavai keeps high court order in abeyance; directs impleadment of DICCI before further hearing

title: Assam Rifles takes note of recruits displaying armed groupâ€™s flag
content: An X user has posted the photo of 21 men in the Assam Rifles uniform posing during a passing out parade with the flag of the Zomi Revolutionary Army

title: Gulzar Houz fire: Human Rights Commission flags lapses, seeks detailed report
content: Commission observed that there may have been gross negligence in building safety, electrical upkeep and fire-readiness on the premises

title: Election Commission begins training programme for field functionaries from Jharkhand

title: Allahabad High Court upholds lower courtâ€™s order appointing Advocate Commissioner to survey Sambhal mosque
content: Court dismisses the mosque committee plea, noting that this was not a case of conversion of place of worship and that the Hindu plaintiffs only wanted right of access to a protected monument

title: Armyâ€™s Western Command removes video showing Pakistanâ€™s Shaheen missile
content: The video was taken down with Army sources saying the images were used â€œfor representation onlyâ€ but it was erroneously not mentioned

title: NIA arrests two persons, including one alleged militant, in Manipur violence cases
content: Last week, the NIA had arrested two other accused militants, belonging to different militant outfits.

title: Gaurav Gogoi dares CM Himanta to set up 2 SITs

title: Teachers should have trusted govt., fought legally, worked beyond politics, says Mamata
content: Teaching and non-teaching staff have been protesting after their appointments were cancelled by the SC citing irregularities in the 2016 recruitment

title: Lucknow locals say Ali Khan was deliberately targeted

While the government is vicariously liable to pay â‚¹6Â lakh, â‚¹40Â lakhÂ is to be recovered from the doctor, â‚¹2Â lakhÂ from a senior civil surgeon, and â‚¹1Â lakh each from two nurses, who too had a role in the transfer of the patient

title: Indus water belongs to Indian farmers, Chouhan assures farm outfits
content: The decision to keep in abeyance the Indus Waters Treaty corrected the historic injustice done to the country by the Jawaharlal Nehru government, he says while addressing farmersâ€™ organisations
